directives.description:
Authentication directive.
Restricts access to certain fields based on current OAuth scope.
directives.name: scope

directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
directives.name: skip

directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.
directives.name: include

args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
args.name: reason

directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.
directives.name: deprecated

types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.
fields.name: types

fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.
fields.name: queryType

fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.
fields.name: mutationType

fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.
fields.name: subscriptionType

fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.
fields.name: directives

types.name: __Schema

types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.
types.name: String

types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.
types.name: __Type

types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.
enumValues.name: SCALAR

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.
enumValues.name: OBJECT

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.
enumValues.name: INTERFACE

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: UNION

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: ENUM

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: LIST

enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.
enumValues.name: NON_NULL

types.name: __TypeKind

types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.
types.name: __Field

types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.
fields.name: defaultValue

types.name: __InputValue

types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.
types.name: Boolean

types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.
types.name: __EnumValue

types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.
types.name: __Directive

types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.
enumValues.name: QUERY

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.
enumValues.name: MUTATION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.
enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.
enumValues.name: FIELD

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.
enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.
enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.
enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.
enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.
enumValues.name: SCHEMA

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.
enumValues.name: SCALAR

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.
enumValues.name: OBJECT

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.
enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.
enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.
enumValues.name: INTERFACE

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.
enumValues.name: UNION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.
enumValues.name: ENUM

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.
enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.
enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.
enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION

types.name: __DirectiveLocation

types.description: The client accessing this API.

fields.description: The provided client name.
fields.name: name

fields.description: For user-authorized tokens, provides the user that authorized the client.
fields.name: user

fields.description: The OAuth scopes that the client has access to.
fields.name: scopes

types.name: Viewer

enumValues.description: Default scope. Allows standard read-only methods.
enumValues.name: PUBLIC

enumValues.description: Allows access to the crawler APIs.
enumValues.name: CRAWLER

enumValues.description:
Allows access to discord guild config APIs (for all guilds).
Used by the discord bot to add/edit guild-specific preferences.
enumValues.name: GUILD_CONFIG

enumValues.description:
Allows access to discord user APIs (for all users).
Used by the discord bot to add/edit user preferences.
enumValues.name: USER_CONFIG

enumValues.description:
Used with the patreon webhook to add/remove patron benefit eligibility.
Patreon rewards themselves (e.g. colors) are still editable by the backer.
enumValues.name: PATREON_HOOK

types.description:
Per-guild config for the discord bot.
Many of the fields have server defaults, so they don't need to be explicitly inserted.

fields.description: Discord guild snowflake ID.
fields.name: guildId

fields.description:
Configured per-guild command prefix.
The default is "crom".
fields.name: commandPrefix

fields.description:
Configured per-guild search prefix.
The default is "??".
fields.name: searchPrefix

fields.description:
The wiki configured to be the guild's default search domain.
Default is "http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com".
fields.name: baseUrl

fields.description:
The minimum rating for pages to be knocked off last-created listings early.
This only applies to pages at least one hour old. This is not configurable.
Default threshold is -3.
fields.name: lastCreatedThreshold

types.name: DiscordGuildConfig

types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.
types.name: Int

types.description:
A discord user and their preferences.
This is currently the closest Crom has to a centralized verified "user".

fields.description:
The discord account id.
Each wiki user can only be linked to one discord account.
fields.name: discordId

fields.description:
Hex code denoting a user-specific color. Currently, this is presented as
the embed color.
fields.name: preferredColor

fields.description: The user associated with this link.
fields.name: linkedUser

fields.description:
Linked user change awaiting approval.
To prevent discord users accessing wiki users that they don't have access to,
each discord link has to be manually approved.
fields.name: pendingUser

fields.description:
A patreon membership associated with this discord account.
Patreon membership data is collected asynchronously using the Patreon API.
See https://patreon.com/crombird
fields.name: patreonMembership

types.name: DiscordUser

types.description: Represents a Page resource. Each URL is canonically tied to a single page.

fields.description: The canonical URL of the page.
fields.name: url

fields.description:
Any non-canonical URLs for the page.
This includes pages that redirect to this one.
fields.name: alternateUrls

fields.description: Information parsed from wikidot pages. Present if the page is a wikidot page.
fields.name: wikidotInfo

fields.description: Alternate titles for the page.
fields.name: alternateTitles

fields.description: Known contributors to the page.
fields.name: attributions

types.name: Page

types.description: Information specific to wikidot pages.

fields.description: The wikidot title of the page.
fields.name: title

fields.description: The integer rating of the page, if present.
fields.name: rating

fields.description: The wikidot page tags.
fields.name: tags

fields.description:
Wikidot's page ID for this page.
Useful when calling wikidot's AJAX API.
fields.name: wikidotId

fields.description: When the page was posted to the wiki.
fields.name: createdAt

fields.description:
The number of revisions made to the page.
The number is used to determine if a page was updated since the last crawl and
skip it if it was.
fields.name: revisionCount

fields.description:
The user that posted this article.
Returns null if the account was deleted before the crawler got to it.
This exists to provide low-level data. Prefer the attributions API to get page authors.
fields.name: createdBy

fields.description: The original URL to the uncropped thumbnail image for this page.
fields.name: thumbnailUrl

types.name: PageWikidotInfo

types.description:
Tracks an alternate title.

Alternate titles are titles derived from outside the page itself. For example,
SCP titles come from a seprate listing page.

fields.description:
The source of the alternate title.

The convention is to use the canonical URL of the page where the alternate
title was found.
fields.name: type

fields.description: The title string.
fields.name: title

types.name: PageAlternateTitle

types.description:
A tracked attribution to the page.
Also enriched with wikidot history where possible.

fields.description: The type of contribution.
fields.name: type

fields.description:
The contribution user.
The provided user's display name may be incorrectly capitalized.
fields.name: user

fields.description:
An optional date of contribution.
If a time is not present, it's rounded down to midnight.
fields.name: date

types.name: PageAttribution

types.description:
The type of attribution.
For more information, see http://www.scp-wiki.net/attribution-metadata

enumValues.description: Primary author or co-authors of the page.
enumValues.name: AUTHOR

enumValues.description: Authors of major rewrites to the page. A date is usually accompanied.
enumValues.name: REWRITE

enumValues.description: Translators of pages originally written in another language.
enumValues.name: TRANSLATOR

enumValues.description:
Maintainer of abandoned pages if rights were explicitly transferred to the author.
Doesn't show up on the SCP wiki.
enumValues.name: MAINTAINER

enumValues.description:
A crom-specific type, pointing to the person who submitted this page.
Returned as a fallback if no explicit attributions are known.
enumValues.name: SUBMITTER

types.name: PageAttributionType

types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.
types.name: ID

inputFields.description: Limit listings to pages with ANY of the provided base URLs.
inputFields.name: anyBaseUrl

inputFields.description: Limit search to pages with ANY of the provided base URLs.
inputFields.name: anyBaseUrl

inputFields.description: Limit search to pages that contain ALL of the provided tags.
inputFields.name: allTags

inputFields.description: Limit search to pages with ANY of the provided base URLs.
inputFields.name: anyBaseUrl

types.description:
PageInfo from the Relay Cursor Connections Spec.
Note that the cursor fields are optional, and are null if no edges are returned.
See https://relay.dev/graphql/connections.htm#sec-undefined.PageInfo

fields.description: Whether more edges exist prior to the returned results.
fields.name: hasPreviousPage

fields.description: Whether more edges exist following the returned results.
fields.name: hasNextPage

fields.description: Corresponds to the first edge in the returned edges.
fields.name: startCursor

fields.description: Corresponds to the last edge in the returned edges.
fields.name: endCursor

types.name: PageInfo

types.description: Standard pagination order indicator for paginatable fields.
types.name: SortOrder

types.description: Benefits awarded to patrons.

enumValues.description: Custom embed color for author embed and on articles written by them.
enumValues.name: CUSTOM_EMBED_COLOR

enumValues.description: Custom emote next to attribution name.
enumValues.name: CUSTOM_EMOTE

types.name: PatreonBenefit

types.description:
Record of a patreon membership, either active or in the past.
This data isn't controlled by the user, but by a trusted Crom process using
the Patreon API.

fields.description: Whether the membership is currently active.
fields.name: active

fields.description: Member ID on Patreon's API.
fields.name: patreonMemberId

fields.description:
Amount pledged in USD cents.
This value is used to reduce contention when embeds featuring multiple
patron authors are created.
fields.name: pledgeCents

fields.description: Benefits that the user is entitled to, based on the patreon tier.
fields.name: benefits

fields.description:
The discord account linked to the member's Patreon account.
This is the account that can receive/edit benefits. For the time being,
a discord account must be linked because this data is useless if one isn't.
fields.name: discordUser

types.name: PatreonMembership

types.description: Query type.

fields.description: Get metadata on the current access token.
fields.name: viewer

fields.description:
Get the config for a certain discord guild by its guild id.

**Notice:** This field requires the `GUILD_CONFIG` scope.
fields.name: discordGuildConfig

fields.description:
Get a discord user by their user id.
Just like `page`, this query will always return a discord user. It's not up
to the API to validate that a discord id resolves to a valid user.

**Notice:** This field requires the `USER_CONFIG` scope.
fields.name: discordUser

fields.description:
Get a page by its canonical URL.

This will always return a page regardless of whether it was scraped. Use
`wikidotInfo` to verify that the page exists.
fields.name: page

fields.description:
Iterate through all pages.
Note that you may run into duplicates as the data is parsed.
fields.name: pages

fields.description: Search wiki pages, returning results in order of relevance.
fields.name: searchPages

fields.description: Get a single random page.
fields.name: randomPage

fields.description: Fetch a user's details by their name.
fields.name: user

fields.description:
Search users.
Search APIs are currently in flux.
fields.name: searchUsers

fields.description: Get all users by a certain rank.
fields.name: usersByRank

types.name: Query

types.description: Mutation type.

fields.description:
Insert or update guild configs by guild ids.

**Notice:** This field requires the `GUILD_CONFIG` scope.
fields.name: insertDiscordGuildConfigs

fields.description:
Insert or update discord user preferences by discord user ids.

**Notice:** This field requires the `USER_CONFIG` scope.
fields.name: insertDiscordUsers

fields.description:
Expire all items with a certain tag inserted before a certain date.
For consistency's sake, this runs over every single type of record inserted into
the database.

Expiry tags reduce the risk of serving invalid data by letting us
expire items as soon as we know they're probably deleted. Cache invalidation on
the cheap! Expiry tags track collections of items that serve as complete views
of a type of resource. Once a collection has been fully scraped, we can say with
confidence that any data scraped before the collection started is no longer valid.

Tags look like `scp-wiki-en/2020-04-13-21-41`, `scp-wiki-en/2019-12-24-18-00`, etc.
This mutation lets us delete everything before the start date of the latest tag,
which clears older tags, given no concurrency shenanigans. Tag names are replicated
across every single expirable item in the database, but that's okay. Storage is cheap,
joins are expensive. In the future, we might have certain optimizations in place that
makes the "before" argument obsolete and replaces it with a tag name, but we need it
for now.

Incidentally, tags also serve another purpose. If a query returns two items but they
both have different tags, you can assume that only one of them is valid, since both
come from complete views of a resource. This prevents returning double data.

Note that users can exist as duplicates, so a user can be expired from one collection
but still return a result from a different collection.

Data inserted without an expiry tag is essentially immune to expiration.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` scope.
fields.name: expire

fields.description:
Insert a PageWikidotInfo for a page by its canonical URL.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` scope.
fields.name: insertPageWikidotInfos

fields.description:
Insert PageAlternateTitles for a page by its canonical URL.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` scope.
fields.name: insertPageAlternateTitles

fields.description:
Insert PageAttributions for a page by its canonical URL.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` scope.
fields.name: insertPageAttributions

fields.description:
Insert or update existing patreon membership info.

**Notice:** This field requires the `PATREON_HOOK` scope.
fields.name: insertPatreonMemberships

fields.description:
Insert a UserWikidotInfo by their display name.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` scope.
fields.name: insertUserWikidotInfos

fields.description:
Insert a UserAuthorInfo by their display name.

**Notice:** This field requires the `CRAWLER` scope.
fields.name: insertUserAuthorInfos

types.name: Mutation

types.description: An absolute URL.
types.name: URL

types.description: An ISO8601-formatted DateTime string.
types.name: DateTime

types.description: A hex color code, starting with "#".
types.name: Color

types.description:
A user represents a singular identity.
Typically, this is their wikidot username or author name.

fields.description: The user's "canonical" name.
fields.name: name

fields.description:
Details about a user's wikidot account, if they have one.
Some authors do not have active wikidot accounts and only exist by reference.
fields.name: wikidotInfo

fields.description: Author details from the sites they contribute to.
fields.name: authorInfos

fields.description:
Discord user linked to this public user.
The link must be manually approved to be accessible from here.

**Notice:** This field requires the `USER_CONFIG` scope.
fields.name: discordUser

fields.description:
Aggregated user statistics.
Can be restricted to certain sources.
fields.name: statistics

types.name: User

types.description: Details about a user's wikidot account.

fields.description: The correctly cased display name for the user.
fields.name: displayName

fields.description: A wikidot-specific user ID. Used for wikidot AJAX API stuff and profile image URL.
fields.name: wikidotId

fields.description:
The user's "unix name" is a slugified version of their wikidot username.
It is used primarily to generate their wikidot profile url.
fields.name: unixName

types.name: UserWikidotInfo

types.description:
Wiki specific details about an established wiki author.
These details are generally standardised across international wikis.

fields.description:
The site where the user is a "registered" author.
This is a base URL that page canonical URLs are based off of.
fields.name: site

fields.description: The user's author page.
fields.name: authorPage

fields.description:
The user's role on the author's pages list.
This doesn't really matter.
fields.name: role

fields.description:
The user's self-description on the author's pages list.
This doesn't really matter either.
fields.name: description

types.name: UserAuthorInfo

types.description: Aggregate user statistics.

fields.description:
Rank amongst other users in this site.
Starts at #1 for the highest.
fields.name: rank

fields.description:
Aggregate rating across all of the user's pages.
Excludes fragment pages.
fields.name: totalRating

fields.description:
Mean rating across the user's pages.
For self-esteem reasons, component and fragment pages are excluded.
fields.name: meanRating

fields.description: The number of pages attributed to the user. Excludes fragment pages.
fields.name: pageCount

types.name: UserStatistics

inputFields.description: Limit searches to authors who authored pages with ANY of the provided base URLs.
inputFields.name: anyBaseUrl

inputFields.description: Limit searches to authors who authored pages with ANY of the provided base URLs.
inputFields.name: anyBaseUrl

types.description: The `Upload` scalar type represents a file upload.
types.name: Upload
